Problem:
Consider a linear system described by the complex function \\(z(t) = Ce^{i \\omega t}z_0\\), where C is a complex constant, \\(\\omega\\) is the angular frequency, and \\(z_0\\) is the initial complex state. We investigate the consequences of an integral transformation on this system, denoted by \\(T_{\\lambda}[z](t) = \\int_0^t e^{-\\lambda (t-\\tau)} z(\\tau) d\\tau\\), where \\(\\lambda\\) is a decay factor.

Knowing the system reaches a specific endpoint \\(z(T)\\), can we determine precisely the type and time of interventions applied (whether \\(T_{\\lambda}[z](t)\\), \\(T_{\\mu}[z](t)\\), or both)?
Explanation: Given the endpoint \\(z(T)\\), multiple scenarios involving different applications of \\(T_{\\lambda}[z](t)\\) and \\(T_{\\mu}[z](t)\\), potentially at different times, could lead to the same final state due to the linearity and complexity in decay integration, leading to an inconclusive identification of the interventions.
